intro: Hieracium pocuticum subsp. klopotivae, commonly known as the Klopotivae hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
